explainability.findings: Policy documents mandate that individuals have the opportunity to discuss the results of automated decision-making processes, including background checks. These documents also require understandable explanations for decisions affecting individuals.
explainability.path_to_improvement: Publish user-facing explanation interfaces or documented appeal workflows.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned policy document, "Corporate Policy Manual Section 24: Data Privacy," provides evidence for the **explainability** and **oversight** pillars. It supports explainability by mandating that individuals have the opportunity to discuss the results of automated decision-making processes, such as background checks. Furthermore, this policy commitment to allowing discussion of automated decisions also demonstrates support for the oversight pillar.
relevant_sources.title: Corporate Policy Manual Section 24: Data Privacy

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Standard Terms & Conditions - Attachment E: Artificial Intelligence Governance," provides evidence for **transparency, explainability, governance, oversight, external accountability, and fairness**. It mandates disclosure of AI presence and capabilities, requiring understandable explanations and human oversight for decisions affecting individuals, thereby supporting transparency and explainability. The policy also establishes an AI risk management system and permits buyer audits for bias assessments and compliance, demonstrating operational execution of governance, oversight, external accountability, and fairness.
relevant_sources.title: Standard Terms & Conditions - Attachment E: Artificial Intelligence Governance

external_accountability.findings: Policy documents permit buyer audits for bias assessments and compliance. Reports describe the operational execution of external accountability through automated algorithms and named AI-driven service programs.

relevant_sources.summary: This "Terms of Use" help page provides evidence for **external_accountability, fairness, oversight, privacy, and transparency**. It supports transparency by committing to notify users of AI changes and detailing specific AI applications like chatbots and energy recommendations. The document also demonstrates oversight through mentions of ongoing monitoring, human escalation, and regular audits, and supports privacy by stating AI processing complies with data protection laws and includes safeguards.
relevant_sources.title: Terms of Use

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, "Standard Terms & Conditions - Attachment E: Artificial Intelligence Governance," provides evidence for **transparency, explainability, governance, oversight, external accountability, and fairness**. relevant_sources.title: Standard Terms & Conditions - Attachment E: Artificial Intelligence Governance

relevant_sources.summary: This policy document, Carrier's 2025 Sustainability and Impact Report, provides evidence for **governance**, **transparency**, and **external accountability**. It details Carrier's AI governance and technology oversight initiatives, including the use of AI in their product portfolio for smarter buildings and connected cold chains, demonstrating transparency in AI capabilities. The report also describes operational execution of governance and external accountability through the use of automated algorithms and named AI-driven service programs like the Carrier Lynx digital ecosystem and BluEdge service program.
relevant_sources.title: Carrier 2025 Sustainability and Impact Report

governance.findings: Policy documents establish Carrier's overall governance structure for policies, identifying a specific Artificial Intelligence Governance policy and outlining procedures for policy issuance and annual review. These documents also establish an AI risk management system. Additionally, reports detail Carrier's AI governance and technology oversight initiatives, while press releases outline the intended use and functionality of AI systems.

relevant_sources.summary: This company-owned charter, "Corporate Policy Manual Section 1: Governance & Definitions," provides evidence for the **governance** pillar of responsible AI. The document establishes Carrier's overall governance structure for policies and specifically identifies CPM Section 30 as the Artificial Intelligence Governance policy, owned by Legal & Compliance. It also outlines policy issuance procedures requiring Executive Committee and Board of Directors approval, along with annual review requirements, demonstrating a structured approach to AI policy management.
relevant_sources.title: Corporate Policy Manual Section 1: Governance & Definitions

relevant_sources.summary: This press release announces LenelS2's reseller agreement for Hakimo AI software, providing evidence for **governance** and **transparency**. The announcement details the AI's capabilities in monitoring security, prioritizing alarms based on risk, and detecting unauthorized access, which implies automated decision-making processes and a defined product strategy. This information supports governance by outlining the intended use and functionality of the AI system, and transparency by describing its operational mechanisms.
relevant_sources.title: LenelS2 Expands Artificial Intelligence Portfolio with Hakimo Reseller Agreement

oversight.findings: Carrier's "Terms of Use" references ongoing monitoring, human escalation, and regular audits related to AI. Policy documents mandate that individuals have the opportunity to discuss the results of automated decision-making processes. Furthermore, policy documents establish an AI risk management system, permit buyer audits for compliance, and require human oversight for decisions affecting individuals.

summary.overall_findings: Carrier Global's public disclosures present evidence for both operational practices and policy-level commitments across its responsible AI pillars. All 7 evaluated pillars have documented public evidence, with operational practices including commitments in the "Terms of Use" to notify users of AI changes and policy documents permitting buyer audits for bias assessments related to fairness and external accountability. Further operational practices are documented in the "Terms of Use" referencing ongoing monitoring of AI for oversight, while explainability and privacy are addressed at the policy level. For explainability, policy documents mandate that individuals have the opportunity to discuss the results of automated decision-making processes. These findings are based on 11 publicly available sources.
